There was no location data within the image
This app is only supported on Verizon Wireless devices.

To improve features and functionality of services provided to you by Verizon Wireless and its content providers, this application may collect anonymous information on your nearby Wi-Fi Access Points. By selecting "Accept" you consent to the collection, use and disclosure of this Wi-Fi data which will not be associated with you in anyway, otherwise select "Decline" to continue.

Running multiple SMS/MMS messaging applications on your phone may impact performance, such as causing notifications to disappear, disrupting the group conversation experience, and altering message timestamps. For the best messaging experience, we recommend only one SMS/MMS messaging app be installed and running on your device.
You can avoid getting multiple notifications about the same message by turning off Notifications in the messaging apps you don’t use.

Limited memory can slow down your phone, especially if you text a lot. From your phone’s Settings menu, tap Applications > Running Services to check available memory. If you have less than 50 MB free, try stopping apps that you are not currently using.

You can back up your messages by saving specific conversations or saving all of your messages by selecting “Save Conversations” or “Settings > Save Messages” from the Verizon Messages app menu. Messages will be saved to your SD card.
Integrated Messaging features can be found in the app\'s Settings.
For smoother syncing, copy all of the contacts from your phone’s address book to your tablet.

- For best performance and usability it's recommended to run only one downloaded SMS messaging application in addition to the stock messaging client. Ensure that the stock client is not running.

 - For improved speed and performance, especially as a heavy messaging user, ensure that your device has sufficient memory (~50M). Go to Settings/Applications/Running Services to check memory and free up memory from applications you are no longer using day-to-day.

 - If running more than one messaging application, avoid multiple notifications for the same message by disabling this feature in seldom used messaging applications.

 - Periodically back up your messages using batch mode "Save Messages" in the application menu.

 - When pairing devices and syncing messages, ensure that devices are on the same local network (Wi-Fi, Mobile Hotspot).

 - Make sure that auto-retrieve is set to ON in Message Settings/Multimedia Message Setting and MMS messages are fully downloaded to your device so that they will appear on your tablet after message synchronization.

 - If device pairing is still not working after confirming that both devices are on the same local area network (Wi-Fi, Mobile Hotspot), try resetting your connection by turning it OFF and ON. Once both devices are connected try pairing again.

 - It is recommended to copy all contacts from the handset's address book to the tablet for improved tablet sync functionality.

Welcome to Integrated Messaging. This service (the “Service”) is provided by Verizon Wireless (“VZW”) so that you can enjoy an integrated, feature-rich, customized messaging experience across multiple devices, including your mobile phone, tablet, PC and laptop. Your use of the Service is subject to your Customer Agreement with VZW and constitutes your acceptance of this Agreement.

 1.	Charges. Your download and use of the Service will be billed according to your messaging and data plans. The same rate will be charged per message per recipient regardless of whether you send your message from your mobile phone, tablet, PC or laptop. Group and location messages will be charged as multimedia messages (MMS). Data usage charges may apply for the synchronization of messages among your devices. When using the Service outside of the U.S., Global Data charges will apply when you send and receive MMS messages. Visit http://www.vzw.com/global for more information. 

 2.	Storage. Your messages will be stored for up to 90 days on the VZW network and will be accessible via your mobile phone, tablet or web browser.

 3.	Location. By using location messaging, you consent and permit VZW to disclose your location information to others in order to deliver the Service. There is no representation, warranty or guarantee of reliability or accuracy, completeness or timeliness of any location data provided through the Service. 

 4.	Usage Information. VZW may use information about your activity in the Service to improve the Service, subject to the VZW Privacy Policy, which can be found at http://www22.verizon.com/about/privacy/. 

 5.	Restrictions on Use. You may not, or allow others to, adapt, alter, modify, de-compile, reverse engineer, translate, or create derivative works of the Service or any included software. 

 6.	Throttling. This is not an unlimited text messaging service. To the extent your messaging volume reaches an extraordinary level, we reserve the right to throttle back your messaging activity for the hour.

 7.	Termination. VZW may terminate or discontinue the Service at any time without notice, including if you breach this Agreement. 

 8.	Disclaimer of Warranty. THIS SERVICE AND ANY INCLUDED SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED ‘AS IS’, WITHOUT WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, OF ANY KIND BY EITHER VZW OR ITS LICENSORS. 

 9.	Applicable Law. The laws of the State of New York, excluding its conflicts-of-laws rules, govern this Agreement. You expressly agree that jurisdiction for any claim or dispute arising under this Agreement shall reside in the federal and state courts in New York County, New York. 

 10.	Safety. Please do not endanger yourself and others by using the Service while driving or engaging in any other activity that requires your full attention. 

 11.	Patents. Your use of this App is subject to the Apache License Agreement, which can be found at http://www.apache.org/licenses/. Certain software or technical information is licensed from third parties, including TeleCommunication Systems, Inc., and may be covered by one or more U.S. Patents, pending U.S. patent applications, and pending counterpart European and international patents.
Please select an option before proceeding.

This Service will give you an integrated and customized messaging experience across your mobile phone, tablet, PC, and other devices. You can also send group, location and other multimedia messages (“MMS”) in addition to traditional text messages. Before you start, we want you to know some important things about the Service.

 1.	Customer Agreement. When you signed up to be a customer of Verizon Wireless (“VZW”), you entered into a Customer Agreement with us. This Service is subject to all of the terms in that Customer Agreement. For the current version of the Customer Agreement, visit: www.verizonwireless.com/b2c/support/customer-agreement.

 2.	Charges. Your download and use of the Service will be billed according to your messaging and data plans. The same rate will be charged per message per recipient regardless of whether you send your message from your mobile phone, tablet, PC, laptop, or other device. Group and location messages will be charged at the MMS rate. Data usage charges apply when using preview, location, and search functions, and for the synchronization of messages among your devices. When using the Service outside of the US, Global Data charges will apply when you send and receive MMS messages. Visit www.vzw.com/global for more information.

 3.	Location. By using location messaging, you consent and permit VZW to disclose your location information to others in order to deliver the Service. There is no representation, warranty or guarantee of reliability or accuracy, completeness or timeliness of any location data provided through the Service.

 4.	Privacy. VZW may use information about your activity in the Service, subject to the VZW Privacy Policy, which can be found at http://www22.verizon.com/about/privacy/.

 5.	Restrictions on Use. You may not, or allow others to, adapt, alter, modify, de-compile, reverse engineer translate, or create derivative works of the Service or any included software.

 6.	Licenses. Your use of this App is subject to the Apache License Agreement, which can be found at http://www.apache.org/licenses/. Certain software or technical information is licensed from third parties, including TeleCommunication Systems, Inc., and may be covered by one or more U.S. Patents, pending U.S.patent applications, and pending counterpart European and international patents.

 7.	Termination. VZW may terminate or discontinue the Service at any time without notice, including if you breach this Agreement.

 8.	Disclaimer of Warranty. THIS SERVICE AND ANY INCLUDED SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED ‘AS IS’, WITHOUT WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, OF ANY KIND BY EITHER VZW OR ITS LICENSORS.

 9.	Safety. Please do not endanger yourself and others by using the Service while driving or engaging in any other activity that requires your full attention.

This feature allows you to pair your Android tablet and Android smartphone devices together in order to synchronize your messages between devices. It allows you to send and receive messages through your tablet device while connected to your smartphone.

 	Messages created from the tablet device, synchronized, and sent via your paired smartphone device will be charged according to your smartphone device’s messaging plan.

This feature allows you to pair your Android tablet and Android smartphone devices together in order to synchronize your messages between devices. It allows you to send and receive messages through your tablet device while connected to your smartphone.

 	Messages created from the tablet device, synchronized, and sent via your paired smartphone device will be charged according to your smartphone device’s messaging plan.

 	Pairing and syncing require that both devices are on the same local network (Wi-Fi or Mobile Hotspot). Once the devices are paired, they will connect automatically and sync when both devices are on the same local network. You may control automatic syncing from within the application’s Settings Menu on both devices.

 	To begin device pairing, please enter the PIN number generated by Verizon Messages running on your smartphone. Launch Verizon Messages on your smartphone and open the menu options on the main screen of the application. Click on More and then Pair Device. Enter the PIN number displayed on the phone into the dialog box below.

Welcome to Verizon Messages. You can now send and receive your messages on your tablet and through the web using Verizon\'s Integrated Messaging service. Press the Get Started link to begin the service. You can also activate the Integrated Messaging service through Verizon Messages\' app settings or through your My Verizon account on the web.

Welcome to Integrated Messaging. You can now send and receive messages on your phone, tablet, and on My Verizon on the web. You can manage the Integrated Messaging features by tapping the Menu button and then Settings.

We were unable to connect your device to synchronize with Verizon Integrated Messaging service. Most likely cause of this is Network connectivity problems. Please ensure that you have valid Network connectivity and you can attempt to reconnect your device to Verizon Integrated Messaging through the Settings menu of the application.

We were unable to connect your device to synchronize with Verizon Integrated Messaging service. You can attempt to reconnect your device to Verizon Integtrated Messaging through the Settings menu of the application.
Sorry, unsubscribing from the Integrated Messaging service was unsuccessful. You may try again from the app or My Verizon on the web.
Sorry, this device cannot send messages to international numbers. Please send international messages using your phone.

Unable to connect to the Internet. You may send and receive messages on your phone, but it may temporarily be out of sync with other devices. The Integrated Messaging service will reconnect once the Internet connection is restored. To manually reconnect, tap Retry.
GCM failed, retrying. New message notifications may fail while the problem persists

Disconnecting will stop the Integrated Messaging service from syncing and will remove all messages from this device only. You may reconnect this device to the Integrated Messaging service at any time.
